name: IceBeach
blurb: A detailed view of the Icebeach region, known for its harsh climate and resilient settlements.

pointsOfInterest.name: Castgate
pointsOfInterest.description: Encased within a dome that holds the winter at bay, Castgate's picturesque beauty was earned through legendary battles against a goddess and an undead horde. Though its streets bustle with prosperity from gems and ships, the common folk work in the shadow of the very magic that shelters them.

pointsOfInterest.name: Flamore
pointsOfInterest.description: Once a secret college where forbidden magic summoned angels and raised the dead, Flamore was annihilated in a necromantic cataclysm of its own making. Now, its crumbling ruins radiate a palpable corruption, twisting any creature who strays too close into a monstrous thing that craves only flesh and warmth.

pointsOfInterest.name: Fractured Point
pointsOfInterest.description: Perched on a wind-scoured spike of rock, Fractured Point greets visitors with the festive dance of colored lanterns. Yet this light is a fleeting warmth in a town where the ceaseless gales have eroded all friendliness, leaving only a grim haven for opportunistic traders who bar the gates at sundown.

pointsOfInterest.name: Gernerum
pointsOfInterest.description: The scorched wreckage of Gernerum is a monument to its fiery end, a tragic grave for a town that once birthed heroes. Locals now shun the ruins, whispering that the only survivor is a timeless hag who wanders the ash, bearing a fragile-looking form that conceals a truly catastrophic power.

pointsOfInterest.name: Houlen Top
pointsOfInterest.description: The fertile valley of Houlen Top serves as the breadbasket of the north, but its farmers are a guarded people who shun outsiders. A primal, territorial instinct lies just beneath their civilized surface, suggesting the town's name is a warning as much as a label.

pointsOfInterest.name: Icemoor
pointsOfInterest.description: From its lonely tower, the watchmen of Icemoor once guarded against horrors seeping from the Winrich Glacier. Now, with the settlement all but abandoned, a few grim, half-mad old men remain, their prophetic whispers lost on the wind as they maintain a forgotten vigil against the whispering, soul-filled waters.

pointsOfInterest.name: Little Rock Mentle Asylam
pointsOfInterest.description: Carved into an isolated shard of rock, this asylum is where the Gilded Nations dispose of their most hardened criminals. Whispers persist of inmates suspended in pocket dimensions of pure void, a fate perhaps inspired by the one prisoner said to have simply unwoven reality to escape.

pointsOfInterest.name: Morana's Fang
pointsOfInterest.description: Claimed by the Goddess of Winter herself, this jagged peak is the tallest point in the world, a place where the veil to the divine thins to a whisper. Those few who survive the brutal, sentinel-guarded ascent return forever changed, haunted by the mountain's crushing silence and the cryptic visions granted at its summit.

pointsOfInterest.name: Mt. Solaria
pointsOfInterest.description: Ironically named Mt. Solaria vents geothermal steam, believed to be the slumbering breath of the destructive dragon that claims tribute from the lands below. This strange warmth creates a perilous allure, drawing the desperate to its slopes, which are littered with the failed mines and forgotten tombs of those who previously challenged its master(s).

pointsOfInterest.name: Ottiker
pointsOfInterest.description: The immigrant town of Ottiker defies the ice, using geothermal waters to produce renowned wine on the shores of Sleetmond Lake. Yet this fragile prosperity, born from a distant homeland, has angered local druids, and now the flow of wine has stopped as the town prepares for a fight.

pointsOfInterest.name: Quilt
pointsOfInterest.description: The tiny hamlet of Quilt weaves its history into its namesake craft, with intricate patterns telling stories of survival against the endless winter. This hardy community owes its existence to the geothermal 'Foaming Burrow,' which churns the loch's waters, allowing them to farm fish.

pointsOfInterest.name: Shiverwallow
pointsOfInterest.description: The largest fishing fleet in the north now sits frozen in its own harbor, the ships trapped like flies in amber. A great wooden wall, once meant to guard against sea threats, now seems to mock the town's grim resilience as its fishers abandon their useless vessels to huddle over holes in the ice.

pointsOfInterest.name: Sleetmond
pointsOfInterest.description: Centered around the Hope Tree, whose power holds the winters at bay, Sleetmond is a place of unsettling druidic ways. Its people, seemingly immune to the cold, harvest from an impossible sugar maple orchard, their strange resilience making them an object of deep distrust to the frozen world outside.

pointsOfInterest.name: The Foaming Burrow
pointsOfInterest.description: A network of steam vents and geysers, the Foaming Burrow is the geothermal heart that keeps the surrounding lands and river and downstream lakes from freezing solid. Legends claim elemental guardians protect this lush, snow-free oasis.

pointsOfInterest.name: The Hope Tree
pointsOfInterest.description: A defiant miracle, this impossibly massive tree radiates a divine warmth, creating a sanctuary the Frostmaiden's chill cannot penetrate. Believed to be a blessing from a rival god, its magical leaves can heal the sick, making it a vital symbol of hope that is now threatened by factions seeking to control its power.

pointsOfInterest.name: Thrawbreak
pointsOfInterest.description: Buried in the shadow of the Auruan mountains and surrounded by the ruins of failed fortifications, Thrawbreak is a town pickled in bitterness and beer. Its people, stubborn trappers cut off from the world, endure their isolation fueled by a tavern that never runs dry and the haunting tavern song, 'The Ferryman's Coin,' a dirge for the world that abandoned them.

pointsOfInterest.name: Whitedrift
pointsOfInterest.description: Clinging to the mouth of the Curse Run, this unstable town is a dumping ground for former asylum inmates and other exiles. Paranoia is the local currency, and the tense peace is often broken by the sight of townsfolk arguing with a percived ghosts of their dead loved ones who whisper from the foul, glacial waters.

pointsOfInterest.name: Winrich Fortress
pointsOfInterest.description: Hewn from stone that drinks the light, this is the infamous seat of Winrich, the first mortal to achieve lichdom. Though heroes are said to have destroyed his echo, the fortress remains, its black walls glowing with a sickly, spectral light on moonless nights, a silent testament to the ancient evil born within.

pointsOfInterest.name: Wynwood Peak
pointsOfInterest.description: Choked by a forest of iron-hard wood, this peak's unnatural resilience is said to spring from an ancient dragon's grave. The crumbling tower of a wizard who went mad trying to master this power now haunts its slopes, a testament to the peak's untamed spirit.

regions.name: Starcaller's Grove
regions.description: The northern kingdom known for its harsh climate

regions.name: Winrich Glacier
regions.description: This Glacier glows a soft sicky green and blue and is said to hold acient horrors.
